body: Hello, @adonnini. *Binding classes are generated by [Android Data Binding Library](https://developer.android.com/topic/libraries/data-binding/start) when project is building

Thank you very much for your response. 

My app, currently integrated with Bighchaindb blockchain, uses the blockchain as storage for AP location information and user location history and mobility profiles. 

The data I store is in maps/lists (asset payload). The size of each asset payload is in the range of 5-10 KB.

Would I be able to use the iroha blockchain in the same way?

One last question. Does the iroha-android application need to be updated to work?

Thanks,

Alex

Hi @adachij2002 , take a look at https://iroha.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api/commands.html?highlight=setaccountdetails#set-account-detail - it is a private (per account) key-value storage, you can store arbitrary information there. Key can be 64 bytes and value is 4 KB at max. Ask Iroha team if you need more, they will likely implement custom constraints.

I do not know about iroha-android, but if it does not work for you -- maybe it is broken :-)

@Warchant thank very much for getting back to me about this.

I will need more than 4kb per asset. But, that's OK. To start with I can certainly work with 4kb.

Who is the Android guru in your team? Could I perhaps contact him/her if I have any questions?

Again, thank for getting back to me,

Alex
Summon @mrZizik

Thanks @Warchant 

Is this the best place to contact @mrZizik?

I added issue #145 it sounds like @mrZizik would be the person to answer that question..

Thanks
What error did you get? Any log would be helpful.

Just debug in to app, params correctly I think. Maybe problem with my Iroha peer setup. Any idea @BulatMukhutdinov @mrZizik @kobaken0029 I got this error for several days :cry: 

![screenshot from 2018-08-08 10-41-20](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11817656/43815052-e77973a4-9af7-11e8-93a9-f99eb123bd66.png)

Update:
Iroha: master branch
Proto: copy from master branch [here](https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/tree/master/shared_model/schema) and [here](https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/tree/master/schema)
Android SDK: 1.4
But still get error, the public key and private key I got from `admin@test` from example folder.
```
[2018-08-18 11:10:08.916164400][th:45][warning] CommandService Stateless invalid tx: Signature: [[Wrong signature [353f151fc9a7db3ec484156647e7c24014af250576699a59eb257a8666615e2ae350e9b7dbead36d203be73c527c1ab8b10a0c98d61defbb04b9fabe25924404;313a07e6384776ed95447710d15e59148473ccfc052a681317a72a69f2a49910] ]]
Transaction: [[Transaction should contain at least one command Wrongly formed creator_account_id, passed value: ''. Field should match regex '[a-z_0-9]{1,32}\@([a-zA-Z]([a-zA-Z0-9\-]{0,61}[a-zA-Z0-9])?\.)*[a-zA-Z]([a-zA-Z0-9\-]{0,61}[a-zA-Z0-9])?' bad timestamp: too old, timestamp: 0, now: 1534590608915 Quorum should be within range (0, 128] ]]
, hash: 708713afdb215a7fdd1b3246ec662a3d992648dc262ca1d5360be94b6d75313b
```

Tested on [iroha-android](https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha-android) repository: This is what client send: - iroha server master branch response: ``` [2018-08-20 02:45:00.811779200][th:23][warning] CommandService Stateless invalid tx: Transaction: [[Transaction should contain at least one command Wrongly formed creator_account_id, passed value: ''. Field should match regex '[a-z_0-9]{1,32}\@([a-zA-Z]([a-zA-Z0-9\-]{0,61}[a-zA-Z0-9])?\.)*[a-zA-Z]([a-zA-Z0-9\-]{0,61}[a-zA-Z0-9])?' bad timestamp: too old, timestamp: 0, now: 1534733100811 Quorum should be within range (0, 128] ]] , hash: 50433a976fa5653f2f6636f6c1260845e47f1b734497e55264f06678aa8e842d ``` - iroha server develop branch response: ``` [2018-08-20 02:55:36.283199200][th:21][warning] CommandService Stateless invalid tx: Transaction: [[Transaction should contain at least one command Wrongly formed creator_account_id, passed value: ''. Field should match regex '[a-z_0-9]{1,32}\@([a-zA-Z]([a-zA-Z0-9\-]{0,61}[a-zA-Z0-9])?\.)*[a-zA-Z]([a-zA-Z0-9\-]{0,61}[a-zA-Z0-9])?' bad timestamp: too old, timestamp: 0, now: 1534733736282 Quorum should be within range (0, 128] ]] , hash: 39835987c5c57ef1ff092b8cdbc55b53f78dd83425743efdfb32cfacf6390da6 ``` Weird that the [default IP](https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha-android/blob/master/iroha-android-sample/build.gradle#L22) of the app `199.247.26.56` just worked.

You can build them via that script https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/blob/master/example/java/build_library.sh from Android NDK code or grab via Gradle prebuilt by us. Detailed processes of both ways are described in our README

I have put `implementation 'jp.co.soramitsu.iroha.android:iroha-android-bindings:+'` into `gradle` file. But It seems like two ways (gradle and Compile the library) with different API?
Ex: `signAndAddSignature` function
https://github.com/BulatMukhutdinov/Iroha-Android/issues/1
Use https://github.com/Warchant/iroha-pure-java instead of bindings.
Hello, @haroonhassan . First of all try to clean and rebuild project. DaggerApplicationComponent class should be autogenerated while building.
@haroonhassan, about adding clients as nodes: it's not in our priority list for now, but we'll think about it after getting to RC.
Add timeout to registration. Waited for 5 minutes - progress window is still in progress
Also, pls check if user already registered - redirect him to the main screen
When registering progress should be shown, button should be disabled
Also, pls check existence of username before creating through GetAccount

This issue is invalid so I closed it.
This PR became invalid.

What server is your app connecting to?

Did you create your own app, or are you using https://github.com/soramitsu/iroha-demo-android ?
I use the sample and connect under the hood it use this server https://point-demo.iroha.tech (which is unavailable for now)

The context. My team and me plan to use this sample as a part of the demo for our solution for hackathon. We have the issue if that server doesn't work. 

Could you please provide your tech guidance how to make it work on our side or deploy our own server into the cloud?

Sorry, this issue is client problem. not server. Caused by mistaken transfer command.
○ transfer
× Transfer
I will fix it as soon as possible then merge to master from develop.

To tell the truth, this issue is fixed on [iroha-demo-android](https://github.com/soramitsu/iroha-demo-android).
Very thanks!
This issue was solved by #77's PR!
Confirm. It works now

This issue was already resolve for me. but not merge to master yet. now, 'develop' branch is usable!
I will merge to master from develop as soon as possible. please just a moment.

Checked on my side. App starts without crash! Thank you for fix. 

Could you please give more details what was the root cause?
I guess I was not prepare keypair for encripting/decripting. but I forced decript on sample app. Maybe, this is my mistaken the usase. Sorry^^;

Excuse me, but I don't get your explanation :( May I ask you to schedule a call to discuss this? It would be good also to go through others questions I have (you may found skype id in email I shared yesterday)

Opps… I'm sorry because I'm not good at my English.
OK, I'm trying to prepare a time. But I'm busy on today. So I will contact you again tomorrow!

Great! Looking forward to speak with you soon

Kind regards,
Dmitry Kazakov
